Violation_Type: Failure to establish legal and factual basis for refugee status determination
Legal_Issue: Whether the RPD erred in determining that the respondent is a member of a particular social group subject to persecution
Application_Facts: Respondent was a Tamil passenger on the MV Sun Sea claiming fear of persecution
Court_Ruling: Judicial review granted; case remitted to a different panel for reconsideration
Defendant_Behavior: RPD failed to link social group membership to human rights or discrimination considerations
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution based on membership in a particular social group and political opinion nexus
Assessment_Factor: Existence of persecution, social group membership, nexus to political opinion
Applicable_Legislation: Section 96 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review under section 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Used: Respondent's identity as a Tamil and passenger on MV Sun Sea
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 96, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Application_Basis: Membership in a particular social group facing persecution
Evidence_Assessed: Insufficient factual findings regarding social group and persecution nexus
Governing_Rule: Under section 96, refugee status requires membership in a particular social group facing persecution, supported by human rights and anti-discrimination considerations
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of sufficient factual findings and legal rationale supporting social group or political opinion nexus
Outcome: Decision set aside, matter remitted for reconsideration
Harm_Assessment: Risk of return without proper assessment of persecution claims
Cause_Description: Respondent claimed refugee status based on fear of persecution as a Tamil passenger on the MV Sun Sea
Evidence_Handling: Failure to properly assess and link evidence to legal criteria
Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 96 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Issues: Insufficient linkage between evidence and legal requirements for social group
Legal_Provision: Section 96, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Assessment: Inadequate evaluation of whether passenger status constitutes a protected social group
Decision_Rationale: Decision was unreasonable due to lack of legal and factual justification
Country_of_Origin: Sri Lanka (implied by Tamil ethnicity and context)
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to support conclusion with human rights or anti-discrimination analysis
